intro: Roureopsis javanica, commonly known as the Javanese starflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
